scenario_text.value:
All this tension’s really gettin’ to me,
Takuma.

I mean, any way you look at it, this is the
moment of truth we’re coming up on here.
It sure is.

And when I think how this is it, all this
other stuff starts racin’ through my head.

Like about everything that’s happened so far.
About Ryo and Shuuji...

And of course Miu too. Kaito really cared for
her, you know?

Yeah. Even after he got thrown into this
world, his first concern was how to help Miu.

Which is pretty incredible if you think about
it. I could barely take care of myself.

I always admired him for...how should I say
it? For not losing sight of what’s important?

He had this unshakable strength when it came
to doing whatever he set his mind to.

So now I don’t know what we can say to him to
keep him from destroying the world.
(Minoru’s right. Kaito always was strong.)

(And not just in terms of brawn. There was an
inner strength to him as well.)

(What could we say to him that would make him
lose his desire to destroy the world?)
(What might actually move Kaito?)
Flattery.
Miu’s words.
What Minoru just said.
Flattery.

Maybe if we say nice things about him like
you just did, Kaito will change his mind.
I doubt it’ll be anything as easy as that.
Yeah, sorry.
Miu’s words.

I can’t think of anything that might move
Kaito as much as Miu’s words.

Well, you’re probably right, but it’s no use
wishing for what we haven’t got.
Yeah, sorry.
What Minoru just said.

I actually think putting your feelings into
words like you did just now is perfect.
Really? You, uh, you think?
Kaito has his heart set on this.

I doubt anything you come up with off the
cuff will be enough to change his mind.

Probably our only option is to tell him
straight up how we really feel about him.

You know, when you put it that way, I think
maybe you’re right.

Man, Kaito can be such a pain in the neck! If
only he weren’t so stubborn!
Even if that’s also what makes him so strong.

Yeah. Kaito’s always been simple and
straightforward.

Maybe that’s why he snapped when he lost
someone really important to him.

When you think about it like that, maybe
being so straightforward isn’t a good thing.

Anyway, I’ll think over what I’m going to say
to Kaito.

I just hope it’s enough to get him to think
twice about destroying the world.

Takuma, Minoru, I’ve found the path that
leads <color=#B41919>farther into the shrine</color>.
G-great, thanks. Come on, Minoru, let’s go.
Right.

I just hope Kaito really hears what we have
to say.
